text: Vaucelles is a railway station located in the commune of Taverny (Val-d'Oise department), France. The station is served by Transilien H trains, on the line from Paris to Persan-Beaumont. The daily number of passengers was between 500 and 2,500 in 2002.STIF - Atlas des transports publics en Île-de-France Vaucelles is located on the line from Ermont-Eaubonne to Valmondois, that was opened in 1876. The line was electrified in 1970.La Vie du Rail magazine June 28, 1970 - Électrification de la gare de Montsoult-Maffliers. (Electrification of Gare de Montsoult-Maffliers) The station was renovated in 2009.http://www.transilien.com/web/webdav/site/transilien/shared/Actualites/20090102-%20travauxengare/Depliant_Vaucelles.pdf ==Gallery== Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 01.jpg|BB 17000 heading for Gare de Paris-Nord Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 03.jpg|Bâtiment voyageurs de la gare Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 04.jpg|Bâtiment voyageurs de la gare Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 05.jpg|Quais de la gare Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 06.jpg|Quais de la gare Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 07.jpg|BB 17000 heading for Persan - Beaumont Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 08.jpg|The train heading for Persan-Beaumont Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 09.jpg|The train heading for Gare du Nord in Paris Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 10.jpg|The station's platform Image:Taverny - Gare de Vaucelles 11.jpg|The station's sign ==See also== *List of SNCF stations in Île-de-France ==References== ==External links== * Category:Railway stations in Val-d'Oise Category:Railway stations in France opened in 1876
